Reviews.Title: “Friendly service in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Chris B
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, right off of the Gran Via, and super close to metro stations, restaurants, bars. Staff was very friendly and helpful, would book dinner reservations, tickets, etc, were very informative about the area, where to find supermarkets and such. They also helped us find alternative transportation to the airport at 4am without shelling out 30euro for a cab. The room was rather small, but well furnished, with a large comfortable bed, lots of lighting choices, large mirrors, a closet, a safe, and a flat screen TV. The free wifi was easy to access, although you have to keep re-entering the passcode, but it had very good reception. The bathroom had an awesome shower. However, the bathroom is separated from the room by a glass wall and large glass door that was difficult to open without bumping into the bed, and didn't close all the way. There is absolutely no sound-privacy in the bathroom, so if you don't like hearing your travel companion take care of business, its best to turn on the TV or go for a walk when nature calls. The windows in our room looked out on an elevator/light shaft, so not a very interesting view, but from other reviewer photos it looks like we were just unlucky with this one. The elevator was a really cool and old-fashioned-but-modernized. The only downside is that if someone forgot to close the gate on one of the upper floors, the elevator will not come down to get you, so you have to walk up the flights of stairs surrounding the elevator shaft. We were only on the 3rd floor so it wasn't too much of a hassle. When we left, our credit card didn't work and we had to pay cash. Several days later, upon returning home and seeing our bank statement, we found that the card had indeed worked and we'd been double charged. We contacted the hotel and within a couple days they had reviewed their records, found that we had double paid and immediately refunded us. They were very apologetic, polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “nicely situated hotel in madrid for reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Tsarmuh
Reviews.Content: It is a rather good hotel in the center of Madrid close to metro station and a lot of sightseeing places. It is near Gran Via, one of the most important avenues in the city and it is good for any trip- business or for fun The building is recently renovated, the rooms are good, as well as the bathroom, everything is near - whatever you want - shops, supermarkets, bars, anything... If you take the tube - 2 or 3 stops - and you are at Prado museum or The Royal Palace, to Plaza Mayor/ my love from the 1st sight/ or Plaza del Sol or El Corte Ingles you can walk. There is a lift in the building, the breakfast is good but served at the building next door / no problem at all for me/. Try to book months before or look for special offers - even now they make discounts. So I recommend this hotel to you

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: William B
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with computer and internet nice room good food

Reviews.Title: “A well positioned hotel for tourists”
Reviews.Author: Bean208
Reviews.Content: Struck lucky again this year with our hotel -maybe it's because we stay for longer than a week. We had a 5th floor room, advisable to stay further away from the noise of the traffic. It had a small balcony so my partner was able to smoke without me having to suffer a "smoker's room". The room size was adequate for our needs and was very clean throughout our stay. The a/c worked well and was very quiet ( we had a mini heatwave). The position couldn't have been better. Just of the Gran Via and across the road from a taxi rank. We caught a taxi to the airport at 03.45 - didn't need to book one there were at least 8 cabs waiting ! ! Also at 25 euros - just a few euros more than catching a night bus and 10 euros cheaper than our cab from the airport on arrival during the day. We have fallen in love with Madrid, Toledo and Sergovia now to decide where in Spain to go on our next visit :-)

Reviews.Title: “could be great, but too many problems”
Reviews.Author: newyoika
Reviews.Content: the wifi here is terrible. i chose this hotel over others largely because of good wifi reviews, but was disappointed. the signal was full-strength but the data connection itself is very slow & times out a lot. forget about loading more than one page at a time, too. if you need to do any amount of internet-work, prepare to be frustrated. it was 90 degrees Fahrenheit when i arrived in Madrid, and the air conditioner did not work for the first 2 days. pretty awful. it is an old-fashioned caged elevator, so if anyone in the hotel leaves the cage door not completely closed, the elevator doesn't work and you are stuck using the stairs. (being a hotel of tourists not used to old elevators, this happens a lot.) the bathroom fixture was falling off the wall, and the shower frame was held together by masking tape. this being said, i must have been upgraded, because my room was huge and had 2 roof balconies and huge windows with great views. that part was awesome. the room wasn't spotless, but clean enough to feel good about it. the staff was also VERY nice. it's a shame about the WIFI and the a/c -- those are the 2 things that might keep me from returning. i'd only stay at a discount rate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, great location, room was a closet”
Reviews.Author: JimboDallas
Reviews.Content: The bathroom did not have a door, like 12 TV stations, and the room had no exterior windows, thus no light other than the florescent bulb. This hotel has a very great location but other than that, not much to offer and other than wifi no real amenities whatsoever. And the rates were not that good either, not for what we received.

Reviews.Title: “Strongly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It was my first stay at the hotel and I met with really nice staff.The hotel has a fantastic location and is a good value for the money. I must say they provide an excellent internet connection! I am certain I shall return to this hotel again next time I visit MADRID

Reviews.Title: “Great Location small rooms”
Reviews.Author: nicksie99
Reviews.Content: A fantastically located hotel , next to Gran Via Metro and easy to find. The rooms are very very small , everything is crammed into a small space and the bathroom has a glass wall, so if you like privacy then dont stay here. The beds where ok and rooms cleaned quite late so you get a chance to have a late sleep , but don't if you have paid for the breakfast , time states up to 10.30am but if you arrive after 9.20am there's only fruit left and the staff have switched off the toaster. The breakfast staff are not that welcoming either , after 5 night stay and 4 breakfast there was no buenos dias from either of them , just whats your room number. With so many people on the PARO en espana, get some decent breakfast staff. The young ladies on recepetion where helpful, friendly and very very professional , at least there are some good staff employed here. Overall the best thing about this hotel is location and reception staff !!

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, aging rooms”
Reviews.Author: Matt F
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights last week, friendly reception and service. When I required a plate with fork and knife, they immediately provided to my room. The room itself has some quirky (not so good) features: 1) very small, can't sit at desk without bumping back of chair to bed, 2) bathroom door opens and blocks easy access into the bathroom itself (think sliders, designers!). 3) the shower is not great - body spray not functional and frankly makes the whole bathroom floor wet. 4) heatling was lacking, (it was very cold in the room, and the only blanket was ripped!) 5) the walls are so thin! you hear every step and cough from neighbors. The location is great, so easy to get to and in a fun area of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: lbello1962
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 5 days, room 206. Staff was great!! hotel rooms small but good for two people max. This is the way to experiance Spain in the middle of everthing, people start partying at 2 am dont stop til 6 am be prepared. very convenient close to all sorts of shops and food, go to the drunken duck bar down the street for a cheap and filling breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to shopping and restaurants.”
Reviews.Author: jen1972
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the beautiful downtown Madrid city. Close distance to Shopping, Restaurants, and Metro station. Very Convenient. Since it was downtown it was also very noisy with ambulances all night. The hotel itself was nice and clean but had a mildew odor. Their was a very nice breakfast downstairs that we thought was included in the price but we were wrong. We should have asked. Our mistake. Our trip to Spain was fabulous and we were able to get this Hotel at the last minute since our flight arrangements changed. It was very expensive compared to others that were nicer, newer and cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: tourist131
Reviews.Content: depressing room shower did not function good location

Reviews.Title: “Baby Moon”
Reviews.Author: dkoschil
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed here October 2009. I was 4 months pregnant. The location is excellent. While a better view would have been nice, it was quiet this way. The weather was nice, so even used the balcony a little. The breakfast was good. The hotel was not incredible, but we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: fox67Barcelona
Reviews.Content: The ONLY advantage is the location but you can find something close with better standards. Basically the room doesn't fit with the description on the website. I was given an upgrade to a superior room the reception told me but I had never such a small superior room, obviously they just cheated me! The bathroom was stuck to the bed so no space! Moreover go there with someone you are intmate with because they have glass wall bathrooms so all your movements can be seen! And all the sounds can be heard! This also gives the romm a very bad smell of humidity. The cleaning ladies were very noisy everything morning so forget your rest if you just went out the night before! No Bar in the hotel either so basically no service. Just skip it!

Reviews.Title: “Sad deterioration”
Reviews.Author: elcliente
Reviews.Content: I have stayed a few times. It just gets worse. The last time, Feb 2010, was THE WORSE. Shower did not not work properly, the fittings are loose, the room was dirty, and the internet, which for business for me was essential, did not work. When you ask for this to be fixed, they did nothing. And they charged me more !!! The location is fine, but for the same amount you can stay in a hostel, and actually get the same or better standard. For half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great central position”
Reviews.Author: VallettaYozhik
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very centrally located right in the begining of Horteleza off the Gran via. It is a pretty basic hotel with no frills attached. The room was not that big but managed not to bump into each other. There were a lot of missing things from the minibar so I notified the reception as i did not want to be charged for them. The Wifi in the room was quiet slow and not that efficient. The bathroom was good with a very good shower. With regards to having breakfast which was quiet plentiful & good one had to go out of the hotel as there was no inside access which we found strange as it was in the same building...

Reviews.Title: “Great Find,great access to all of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Sneeo29
Reviews.Content: I stumbled across this place while wandering around Madrid one day. Stayed in another place nearby but had to get out due to noise and lack of a/c. PP Ducal pretty much saved my life. Only here for a night but really enjoy it. The big double room also has a balcony with great views across the skyline of central Madrid. Staff were really great too,helpful and spoke perfect English.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay and hotel staff very helpful”
Reviews.Author: philliboy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. We were given room 201 which was at the back of the hotel so we were not disturbed by noise from the road The room was adequate, the towels and bed linen were changed every day and the staff at reception were always helpful and friendly. The hotel location was excellent for everything and we would stay here again. Madrid is a beautiful city well worth a visit. The open top bus tour was good value for money and lasted for over an hour. We also recommend a visit to Parque del Retiro it will take your breath away.

Reviews.Title: “Very Recommended.”
Reviews.Author: travelchic89
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a good location from everything. I loved the free internet we had & the room was very comfortable, plus the 3 other members I stayed with-we all had our own beds. The customer service was good too. We had a good view, but it was noisy, but that was no problem to me.

Reviews.Title: “can't complain, convenient and pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: divinidylle
Reviews.Content: i just came back from this hotel and the location is perfect, just a few meters away from the GRAN VIA metro station and also at Chueca area. The WIFI is included in the price and was always working when I was there. Just be carefull as some of the rooms only have windows to an inside yard, so no lights, or air :-( and obviously very dark. I straight away asked the girl at reception to have another room facing the front side (with a but of light please) which they accomodated for the day after. Rooms are clean, with air-conditioning, fridge and safe. You cannot hear noise from the street, I was on the 3rd floor and this was nice as well. For the management, I would recommend to add at least one french channel to the international ones already found on TV (France 24 or TV5 for example). The only real complaint about the hotel is that the reception windows (facing the road) could be more regularly cleaned as they were very dirty the 3 days where I stayed which I find does not give a good image of the hotel when you arrive or pass by. But having said that I was globally happy with my stay considering that you can have very bad surprises in Spain with hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: PanayiotisMykonos
Reviews.Content: The location was excellent. The service was not so good because I should ask for cleaning service, the receptionists (some of them) didn't speak English and none was checking the mini bar for refill. The breakfast was good although they were not putting fresh cakes for several days. If you stay there do not get a room in the front where there's much noise!

Reviews.Title: “Simple, clean and central”
Reviews.Author: twofourseven
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a central, clean central and cheap hotel in Madrid and this chained fitted the bill. It is built into an old town-house and has plenty of bars around it for breakfast. You can't go wrong if you are just looking for somewhere to crash. Only thing I'd say against it is the pillows, not enough. But hey, it was value.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: Bal_7
Reviews.Content: The Petit Palace Ducal is located just off one of Madrid's main roads, the Gran Via, so is a great base from which you can see the rest of the city. . I stayed in a room for 4 which was actually nicely decorated (most rooms made for 4, I have found, tend to be quite hostelly-looking in my experience). The room was clean and they also come equipped with a PC and you can surf the web for free which was great. The TV has a good range of channels although the sound seemed to have been turned off on the MTV channel which was disappointing. The shower may be a little on the small for some and the glass door to the bathroom which you can't lock (eek!) may also not be to everyone's taste. Thankfully the door is frosted! I stayed from Wed-Sun and while the hotel was quiet, on Friday this all changed to the point that you can hear those in nearby rooms as clearly as if they're in your own room! However because we were all so tired this didn't stop us from sleeping (too much). But the location, while great 'cos it's central may be a problem because of the noise. Hortaleza Street is very busy and there are literally hoardes of people on the street right up to about 6am on Friday's and Saturday's. While the general hubbub is blocked by the double glazing it's not enough to zone out the sounds of sirens which can be heard frequently. Would I stay here again? I probably would. It was good value for money and just had a generally nice feel to it and was in the heart of the action.

Reviews.Title: “One Night In Madrid....”
Reviews.Author: gazza353
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at this hotel between travels recently. The location is excellent - right across from an underground stop and just off the Gran Via (shops, restaurants etc.). It's also in the heart of the (gay friendly) Chueca area, so is ideal for bars etc. later on. The room was clean and modern, if a bit on the small-ish side, and, like other reviewers, we didn't care much for the frosted glass bathroom door (but this was more because ours sounded like it was going to crack at any minute rather than modesty issues...lol). Overall, a good reasonably priced hotel that I'd recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Generally good value”
Reviews.Author: adv69
Reviews.Content: The rooms seem to vary, I have stayed here twice or three times, and each time they have given me a room overlooking the street, which has a pretty view but is noisier. Generally for the price and excellent location, this is a very good place to stay; all the staff this time were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but only for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: harvey054
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights. Double room was very small, with no view. Room was reasonably quiet (as it was away from the street) but heard noises from next room's squeaky floor and shower room. Also heard running water from the pipe box in the room. Opaque glass screen/door between bedroom and shower room had a small clear panel enabling view through! However hotel is in a great location bang in the middle of tourist Madrid, and with a metro station (Gran Via) across the road. If in Madrid visit the Reina Sofia and Prado museums, The Royal Palace, Temple of Debod, Retiro Park, Plaza Major and Santiago Bernabeau Stadium - brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Humorously Flawed”
Reviews.Author: marybanilow
Reviews.Content: Nice clean modern hotel with superb location, right off Gran Via, in Chueca. The staff was great, the price was good, and the internet's free too. The place, however, has some odd design flaws they really should work on. First, the glass wall separating the bathroom is absurd. It's mostly opaque, but there's a square of clear glass positioned perfectly so that anyone in the sleeping area can't help but see (and hear) whatever's going on at the toilet. This bothered my companions more than me, but it was ridiculous. We ended up taping a map over it with tape that a previous guest apparently left for us. Another strange flaw is the shower. It takes a few minutes to figure out the system. When you do, a number of warm jets of water hit you, which is nice. Unfortunately, the shower's drain can't keep up, so it floods over in minutes. Noise wasn't a problem, but the window to our room (the 'family room') opened to a wall. At the end of te day we paid a great price of about 35 Euro a piece for a clean place in a good location, so we just laughed off all this. I just hope the hotel reads this and fixes that wall and drain.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting!”
Reviews.Author: waltinho
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Petit Palace Ducal with a group of students in February 2006. It is a beautiful hotel and is right near the Gran Via. However, the strangest thing was that the bathroom walls are opaque glass and the door is partly clear glass so that you can see right into the bathroom. I have never seen anything like this. There were also several problems with water leaking through the ceilings. These problems may have been rectified by now, but it was an interesting stay, to say the least. Staff, however, was very helpful and the rooms (other than the bathroom) were nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: coldmore
Reviews.Content: Great location (much beter then several other Petit Palaces we discovered while walking around). Clean rooms. Helpfull staff. Nice breakfast. Free internet service at the reception area. Would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, but bed as a rock”
Reviews.Author: espeso
Reviews.Content: Breakfast: Yummi Room: Trendy and cool Bed: Hard as a rock - as usual in Spain. The queensize bed was just two small ons "put" together. Service: Very good

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Packhorse
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located off the Gran Via half way between the Prado & the Palace and near some wonderful restaurants. Muddle with booking but fortunately there were spare rooms and it was quickly sorted out. Staff all very pleasant. Breakfast reasonable. Rooms basic (but we expected that at the price) but badly thought out eg no hooks, no drawers, floppy anglepoise lights. Main problem was in December the heating was nowhere near adequate. If we came back in the middle of the day even after an hour we were still frozen. The Manager very polite and concerned but could only offer a blanket! Warmer after 7pm.

Reviews.Title: “got bumped”
Reviews.Author: Lasairfhíona
Reviews.Content: This trip to madrid was a big deal for my friend, as it was her first two nights ever away from her two-and-a-half-year old and it was my treat to her. i had booked the Petit Palace at Sol, the Londres one, and we arrived there to be told... that "there is no water. There is no electricity. There is no services today in the hotel. we are closed." Funny enough, the lights were on in the hallway, guests were trotting up and down the stairs, and his computer was on - which he was staring at, clearly realising that they had over-booked. i had e-mailed the day before to reconfirm, and we arrived at 1pm, so it wasn't like we were checking in very late in the day. We got sent to a sister hotel, the Ducal, at Gran Via. No apology, nothing to make up for the mix-up, even an offer of breakdfast or a drink from the bar. Not impressed. Plus, we wasted some of our precious time in the transfer. The shower didn't work in the first room we were given, and we had to move again for the second night. So, all that stuff was very annoying!!!! However, it was cheap - 220 euro for a twin for two nights. The location was great, and the second room had a tiny balcony which we sat out on before dinner, using the luggage stool as a second seat. It does look tired, though - the flooring is fake wood planks and the walls badly need painting: our room had several hand-marks, and chipped paintwork. i had thought from the pictures online it was much snazzier, Also, neither room had a price list for the minibar, again annoying, especially as it turned out to be very expensive for the two tiny bottles of cava we had!! So watch out for being bumped from this chain. You could end up in another part of town from where you chose to be. The only good thing was the staff at the Ducal were very nice. And we had a great weekend anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: MetropolisMark
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at the Petit Palace based on reviews read here. I had a 5 day stay at the hotel. If you have kids sorry I dont think you should stay here! Reason why? see below.. It location cannot be beaten it is smack bang half way between the museum area (15mins walk max) and the civic area (royal place, cathedral and old town etc 10mins). It is a generally smart looking hotel, although many of the features sound good alas, they dont always work or exist. I requested a 6th floor room 2 months before arriving to be told at arrival that I was on the first floor. The rooms are small but with good storage space and are contemporary and clean. Unfortunately I had to move rooms as the famous power shower (room 105) is squeezed into such a small area it is hard to enjoy a shower without hitting the adjacent sink (plus the shower rail collasped) , note that the 'wetroom style' bathroom didnt drain as fast as the shower! You are therefore limited to a 1-2min shower otherwise you flood the room. Although this clearly maybe a one off and be resolved when you read this. I hope. Reception were accomodating and moved me and my other half to another room ( room 107) , again clean and modern. However many features were already falling apart, the curtains were hanging off the rails, the bedside lights behind glass panels (as shown on the sexy pics) built into the bed unit had slipped onto the floor, which was a bit worrying as they burnt dust on the floor. Despite the double glazing the noise is bad- not one for light sleepers. The traffic police take pride in their whistle technique (Its like mardi gras in Rio without the dancers). The refuse trucks empty the bins at 2am every night, and then you have the club revellers going home. I had been to the bars and clubs of course, but you only get little noise from 4am-7am. One major concern - After a lot of banging directly outside the room at 2am I went out to investigate, opposite 107 is the fire exit. I opened the door to see 5 housekeeping trollies stored there, ready for the next day. Blockin the stair well with sheets, bottle of chemicals etc. I looked up the fire escape staircase and it was being used for storage of all sorts of boxes and bizarrely a pressure washer -right in the middel of the stairs - your would have to leap to get over it! . I was glad not to be on the much praised 6th floor! This must be illegal. I know hotel fires are thankfully rare but I remember 32 backpackers killed in OZ at a badly run place and have been in a few fire evacuation and bomb scares and real bombs thanks to living in london. Fire routes exist for a reaon! Even in a false alarm a rush down those stairs could end up in a fatal crush with it being totally blocked. Quickly and finally two other niggles. My key card had to be reset 2 or 3 times a day, i would leave and then try to get back in my room but it would open so down stairs to get it reset. Once 3 times within 2 hours.Apology? Nope! After 5 days and over 15 visits to reception, i realised the 'petit' part of the name summarised the service. Lastly the high speed internet isnt available in all rooms and the first room the remote didnt work. Petit Palace is part of the "High Tech" Spain hotel alas thats an oxymoron. Looks good on the surface, so ok for 1-2 night, but longer stay, nope! A shame really.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, central AND quiet”
Reviews.Author: boonyc
Reviews.Content: Great location. Right in the middle of the trendy neighborhood Chueca, which is full of cute shops, great restaurants and bars, and happening gay nightlife. However, our room, which faced the street but was on the 6th floor, was very quiet! We also had a balcony which was fabulous. The room was modest, but clean, and the free internet was a bonus (although it would be nice if the room with the computers was air conditioned, too). The AC in the rooms is controlled individually and you can leave it on when you leave, which makes for a blissfully cool return in August! Recommend hotel for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: Kaleho
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location... right off of the metro (Gran Via exit) and close to EVERYTHING (go to the Plaza Mayor). I travelled with two friends and shared a triple room. The room was a bit small, BUT realize that we are Americans, so everything in Europe is small compared to what we're used to. The bathroom is as everyone mentioned... one wall of frosted glass with a squre filigree cut out that let's you see the person sitting down... if you catch my drift. It was conventional and worked for three ladies that had way TOO MUCH luggage. Noise was a factor in the beginning but after 10 days in Spain we realized that it's pretty much the same anywhere you stay (walls are thin). It wasn't terrible but we did hear party people coming in at 5am. We did the same thing to our neighbors the following night so, what can you do but say "Es lo que es" (it is what it is). We stayed there our first night in Madrid and went on to do a tour throughout Andalucia. Petit Palace Ducal was pretty inexpensive, compared to the other hotels. You do have to pay for breakfast, I recommend going somewhere else for breakfast if you have the time... if you don't have the time, go for it... just know it is a bit pricey but decent. Very different for Americans, you have to remember you're in another country, be careful with the coffee machine... it's like espresso... didn't drink the coffee, went down the street to Starbucks. There are pubs, restaurants, bars (Cervecias), shops all around. No need to worry about needing transportation. We actually used the metro to get to our hotel from the Airport (Barajas), the maps are straight forward and we got there easily (navigation wise), lugging our 60lb luggaage was a different story. My point is, use the metro. It is less expensive, pretty easy to use and takes you pretty much all over. The staff is as helpful as they can be BUT their English was like my Spanish... which wasn't very good. But between my bad Spanish and their bad English... it worked itself out. All in all it was great for the money. Bring your walking shoes and get ready for some Vino!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Moffin
Reviews.Content: I travelled with two other girls, and Madrid was our first stop. Wow, were we impressed by this hotel! The only thing that threw us off a little bit is the bathroom door (whoever has stayed there will get what I mean!), but the breakfast was amazing, internet access was free, it was close to transport, food, sights, banks, everything! The staff was very friendly and helpful as well. It was a really great start to our trip and as we kept on travelling through Europe we only wished other hotels were like that.

Reviews.Title: “Petit Palace Ducal and Arenal”
Reviews.Author: missy0001
Reviews.Content: Would not go through petit palace chain again. 3 days before I was due to travel with a group of 12 girls for my hen weekend they decided to relocate me to a hotel near the airport. After much anger down the phone to the hotel they did sort me out a hotel on the Gran Via which turned out alright. Petit palace ducal. However the rooms were quite small. for 3 people they basically put an extra bed into a room for 2 people so a little crowded. There was no tea/coffee making facilities, the shower leaked so we had a little stream running through the room and the air conditioning didn't work.. Luckily we went in April so it wasn't baking hot but to get some cool air you had to open the windows - not a good idea on the main street through madrid as lots of noise all day and night. I am glad they moved us to the ducal hotel, as we walked past the Arenal and this looked terrible. Right in a small side street directly opposite a night club. Wouldn't recommend this chain of hotels and definitely would try to avoid them on my next trip to madrid. However would say that the staff were very helpful and polite and did speak good english.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous for shopping”
Reviews.Author: Maryam3
Reviews.Content: Irish mother with two teenage daughters loved the hotel, the staff and the location. We stayed end of January and all the shops had their sales on. Lots of shoe shops and trendy boutiques outside your door. Hotel within walking distance of Puerto del Sol, also located right beside the Metro Grand Via station and all main attractions are easily accessible. Staff very helpful and rooms clean and modern.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location but be aware...”
Reviews.Author: Gazmos
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that the Petit Palace Ducal is quite a good place to stay. I would recommend it for a short stay. The best features about the hotel are its central location just off Gran Via and 1 min from the Metro, the rooms are clean and comfortable, there is a secure safe in the room operated by the magnetic strip on your credit card (free), and the hotel represents good value for money. There are plenty of good cafes and bars if you head up C. Hortaleza. The downside was the noise from the Gran Via which was quite loud if you had the windows open. The room is air-con BUT only in summer and when we were there is was off for the winter season. This time of year it was 25C in the day and this meant we had to spend a couple of hours cooling the room down with the windows open and then closing them to sleep. The location could shock some - if you head towards Puerto del Sol you will encounter the main prostitute strip that operates day and night. If you head in the other direction up C. Hortaleza you are in the main gay district. That said this is a great area for food and entertainment. Watch out for pickpockets on the train from the airport - a group of 3 people will move around you and distract you by picking up you bag, cursing you etc. Just move away from them - don't be polite!. Keep your wallet secure - not in your coat pocket or your back pocket!

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place to stay”
Reviews.Author: pj4ucla
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Petit Palace for four nights. Other than the noisy street below us (which was remedied by closing the windows) the hotel was clean, the staff friendly, and the bathroom door not too embarrassing. The shower with all the nozzles was great! We would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Never again.......”
Reviews.Author: Yoli
Reviews.Content: Fortunately I only had to spend one night in this hotel. I work for a group of hotels so maybe I'm just too critical BUT - the bathroom smelt strongly of damp, first floor room street side is very noisy, you can hear anyone passing in front of your room on the landing. I asked for a late checkout - they gave me til 14.00. At 13.00 the cleaner was knocking the door & reception ringing. I returned to the hotel at 17.00 to collect my cases to go to the airport, and when I asked to use the restroom was told that there isn't one. Was advised to look in one of the bars down the road! Wrote a letter of complaint to Management - they didn't bother to reply. By the way - for continental, the breakfast isn't bad.

Reviews.Title: “Good facilities and 'particular' bathroom door”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a nice and spacious corner-room on the 6th floor with a view over Calle Hortaleza.We were amazed when we found out that in our room there was a computer with a free broadband connection.The bathroom door revealed to be hilarious at best. It was a see-through glass door, so there was no privacy at all on that account. It was sort of funny for us but I imagine it could get a bit uncomfortable for somebody else.I've to admit that the staff didn't impress me that much except one guy, that was kind and professional.The hotel is in a good position to reach almost every place and considering everything, it was a very good value for money.
